intro: Adenogyrus braunii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and prefers well-drained soil. Its foliage is often velvety and dark green, while its flowers come in a variety of colors including purple, pink, and white. Adenogyrus braunii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
